title: Continuous Monitoring Responsibilities

content.content: ScaleSec provides augmented continuous monitoring support. Here's what you need to know.

items: **Monthly POA&M Updates**: Pull findings from Security Hub, categorize, track remediation
**ConMon Package**: Prepare monthly deliverables for FedRAMP PMO
**Finding Investigation**: Use AWS tools to validate and document security findings
**Incident Support**: Assist with investigation and documentation (Pete leads response)

content.content: Remediation timelines: High - 30 days, Moderate - 90 days, Low - 180 days. Missing these requires deviation requests.
Access via AWS IAM Identity Center. Primary tools: Security Hub (finding aggregation), GuardDuty (threats), Inspector (vulnerabilities), Config (compliance), Incident Manager (response tracking).

items: By 25th: Draft POA&M and ConMon package to Shelly

content.content: For detailed procedures, refer to the Continuous Monitoring Plan.

**Pete (CTO/ISSO)**: All security decisions, risk acceptance, remediation priorities
**Shelly**: Documentation standards and PMO submissions
**ScaleSec**: Investigation, reporting, recommendations (no decision authority)

keyTakeaways: Monthly POA&M and ConMon deliverables are your primary responsibility
Pete makes all security decisions - you provide recommendations
Strict remediation timelines: 30/90/180 days for High/Moderate/Low
Submit drafts to Shelly by the 25th of each month
